coggame
Class ImageTool

java.lang.Object
  coggame.ImageTool

public class ImageTool
extends java.lang.Object

The ImageTool is a collection of utility routines for dealing with Images.

Constructor Summary

Method Summary
static java.awt.Color[] getColors(java.awt.Image i)
          Scan an image and compile a table of all the colors used.
static java.awt.Color[][] getPixels(java.awt.Image i)
          Unpack an image into a 2D grid of AWT Color values for easy manipulation and inspection.
static boolean hasTransparency(java.awt.Image i)
          Returns true if the supplied image has any pixels that are not completely opaque.
static boolean hasTransparency(java.awt.Image i, int tileWidth, int tileHeight, int tile)
          Returns true if a given 0-indexed tile within the supplied image has any pixels that are not completely opaque.
static java.awt.Image recolor(java.awt.Image i, java.awt.Color[] find, java.awt.Color[] replace)
          Replace every instance of a color in the first table with the corresponding color in the second table.

recolor

public static java.awt.Image recolor(java.awt.Image i,
                                     java.awt.Color[] find,
                                     java.awt.Color[] replace)
Replace every instance of a color in the first table with the corresponding color in the second table. Any colors not present in the first table will be unchanged.

Parameters:
i - the source image
find - the colors to scan for
replace - the resplacement colors

hasTransparency

public static boolean hasTransparency(java.awt.Image i)
Returns true if the supplied image has any pixels that are not completely opaque.

Parameters:
i - the source image

hasTransparency

public static boolean hasTransparency(java.awt.Image i,
                                      int tileWidth,
                                      int tileHeight,
                                      int tile)
Returns true if a given 0-indexed tile within the supplied image has any pixels that are not completely opaque.

Parameters:
i - the source image
tileWidth - the width of a tile in pixels
tileHeight - the height of a tile in pixels
tile - the index of the tile to examine
